title: I literally* can't get through a game without having to /mute all
body:
*unless I'm playing with four friends.

I try and try to give this community a chance, but I regret it every time.

replies.body: I don't even pay attention to the toxicity. If I muted my whole team all the time, I wouldn't have any of the friends that I do now. There's just too many good people to just mute them all.

Confirmation bias. You're just noticing the bad games because you're not looking for the good ones. Like how pokie players only notice their wins because that's the only time the machine rattles and makes loud noises.
You don't even have a real argument. Your saying "I know your game experience better than you do, trust me :^)"

> [{quoted}](name=Robin Song Robin,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NULiG2Es,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-04-06T06:06:54.419+0000)
>
> Confirmation bias. You're just noticing the bad games because you're not looking for the good ones. Like how pokie players only notice their wins because that's the only time the machine rattles and makes loud noises.

When I look for the good ones it's just games no one says anything. If words are typed in chat they are always negative.

I literally* can't get through a game without noticing at least one bug that is significant to the outcome of the game.

I try and try to give Riot a chance, but I regret it every time.

*... um. Yeah, no, literally.

EDIT: Sorry for off-topic, but it was too perfect. Toxic players are a pain too, I agree.
Last game I was first blood against a Lee Sin that hit me a Q that passed through 3 of my minions. I still don't know what to think about it.

Sounds about right. Hitbox/collision are notoriously screwed in LoL. Funnily enough, this video shows that exact skill shot failing super hard.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SuiGn6_uIxY

> [{quoted}](name=ShinobuElveszett,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NULiG2Es,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-04-06T09:42:37.846+0000)
>
> Last game I was first blood against a Lee Sin that hit me a Q that passed through 3 of my minions. I still don't know what to think about it.

Well, if he used his FIRST Q and it went through 3 minions, that IS bullshit. If it was the second part (Where he kicks your face and appears next to you), then it is NOT bullshit.
How lucky i feel that i never need to mute everyone every game. in fact i dont remember if i ever used the feature!
I find remaining in a neutral standpoint but with a overall positive attitude ends well. Some People will always be toxic and there's mo changing that sadly
I've notice people who have to mute someone are equally toxic.
